entry.title: Miso Extra: ‘POP’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Miso Extra: ‘POP’

 Best New Music

Earcandy, the debut album by Japanese-British singer and producer Miso Extra , is an infectious mix of K-Pop, UK Garage, tongue-in-cheek sensibility, and sultry, ear-catching textures.

Jun. 13

entry.title: Turnstile: ‘Never Enough’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Turnstile: ‘Never Enough’

 Best New Music

Formed in 2010, Baltimore’s Turnstile are a band that always moves forward boldly and collectively — despite what their name might suggest.

Jun. 12

entry.title: Pearl & The Oysters: ‘Sous la lune mandarine’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Pearl & The Oysters: ‘Sous la lune mandarine’

 Best New Music

“Under The Mandarin Moon,” or as Pearl & The Oysters say “Sous la lune mandarine,” is the latest example of the group’s musical superpower: exploring a difficult subject over a…

Jun. 11

entry.title: NxWorries: ‘Everybody Gets Down’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
NxWorries: ‘Everybody Gets Down’

 Best New Music

Grammy Award-winning duo NxWorries (Anderson .Paak and Knxwledge) have returned with the dance floor ready banger “Everybody Get’s Down.”

Jun. 10

entry.title: L'Eclair: ‘Run’ (Feat. Gelli Haha) (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
L'Eclair: ‘Run’ (Feat. Gelli Haha)

 Best New Music

Genre-hopping Swiss outfit L’Eclair are the sonic equivalent of the pastry they’re named after.

Jun. 9

entry.title: Rochelle Jordan: ‘Crave’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Rochelle Jordan: ‘Crave’

 Best New Music

Visionary artist Rochelle Jordan has a clear role in the design of future R&B. “Crave” is a dance floor-ready gem about passion and love that’ll keep you looking forward.

Jun. 6

entry.title: Tanika Charles: ‘How Long Will It Take’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Tanika Charles: ‘How Long Will It Take’

 Best New Music

Canadian soul star Tanika Charles has done a lot of mending in her life.

Jun. 5

entry.title: Yuno: ‘Blest’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Yuno: ‘Blest’

 Best New Music

Enjoy the ebullient title track from NYC-based producer Yuno’s debut album, Blest. Honing his skills in his Floridian childhood bedroom eventually led to broader platforms.

Jun. 4
